definition: to try to form friendly ties with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
to try to gain sb's friendship
to seek contact with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
to feign civility (idiom)
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to throw one's weight around/to put on airs
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to show deference to sb by obliging them (or by obliging sb associated with them)
to congratulate
to use social connections/to toady to influential people
to seek to profit by family ties
to introduce (sb)/(esp.) to present to the emperor
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
to sound out opinions/to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning
to make friends with
